title: A Sympathetic Thorn in the Side of the Bookburners
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:black-highlighter-theme]]
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:dustjacket]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]

[[div style="border:solid 2px #112211; background:#DDEEDD; padding:25px; margin-bottom: 25px;"]]
[[size 150%]] **A Sympathetic Thorn in the Side of the Bookburners** [[/size]][[footnote]]That sounds pretentious as all hell. — M.X.[[/footnote]][[footnote]]I thought you didn't want anything to do with the documentation? — F.L.[[/footnote]][[footnote]]Well, I wouldn't have to if you were actually capable of representing events as they occurred, now, would I? — M.X.[[/footnote]]

[[>]]
**The Eurtec Resistance**
[[/>]]

[[div style="overflow:auto"]]

[[div style="border:solid 1px #112211; background:#EEF6EE; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 3px;"]]
[[=]]
**Conspectus**
[[/=]]

The masses of Eurtec[[footnote]]So-called "Capital of the Coalition". Rather surprising that they wouldn't have chosen a less anomalous city for that title. — F.L.[[/footnote]] have risen up against their oppressors, the Bookburners, who would have them trampled below their lofty towers. Abandoned by their shepherds long ago, it has fallen upon the flock to resist; an incursion into the Bookburners' facilities was inevitable.

Having researched extensively the methods and madness of the Bookburners, we sought to break their hold on the city through the destruction of their technological vices and computational terminals. To an extent, we were successful, but heavy casualties, even with the assistance of other unbroken, have proven that even the Library is no match for the cruel hand of the Bookburners.
[[/div]]

[[div style="border:solid 1px #112211; background:#EEF6EE; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 3px;"]]
[[=]]
**Illustration**
[[/=]]

[[=image supercomputer.jpg width="250px"]]

A fraction of a fraction of the Bookburners' computational might[[footnote]]Their systems are far surpassed by those of the city itself, but the Nornir have long since turned their backs to the plight of our people. — F.L.[[/footnote]]. Note the presence of an unidentified thaumaturgic manifold on the left, the origin of which is unknown.

[[/div]]

[[div style="border:solid 1px #112211; background:#EEF6EE; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 3px;"]]
[[=]]
**Knowledge**
[[/=]]

**Traits:** A computational network through which the Bookburners oversee every corner of the city. Even the contents of a closed book would not be safe from their All-Seeing Eye[[footnote]]Contrary to popular belief, ASE doesn't stand for All-Seeing Eye, but rather, Anderson Surveillance Entity. Originally commissioned by the Bookburners as part of an agreement that guaranteed Anderson Robotics and their partners amnesty for several decades. Of course, that contract expired years ago, but the Bookburners were able to get the Eye working in some capacity once the warranty ran out. — F.L.[[/footnote]][[footnote]]I find it hilarious that Anderson outfits everything he makes with a self-destruct protocol — and he actually used it on the Coalition once they terminated their agreement. Make no mistake, he's still an asshole, but hey, at least he's a badass asshole. Badasshole? — M.X.[[/footnote]], housed in a facility known to the uninitiated as the offices of MAGE Computing. Inside, however, defenses abound, with no shortage of thaumaturgic weaponry.

**Nature:** The Bookburners' hold on the city primarily derives from their control over the material city — countless eyes in the darkest corners and a chokehold on our bare essentials, be it food, water, or safety.

**History & Associated Parties:** Tensions have abounded in Eurtec for nearly half a century. The life of a citizen of the Blood District is one of pain and fear, contrasted greatly by the ever-increasing wealth and power of the Golden District. This strain is further imposed by the hand of the Bookburners, who persecute the anomalous and imprison all who oppose them.

**Approach:** We spent the greater part of a month researching the Bookburners' strengths and weaknesses, as well as rallying for the support of sympathizers in the Eurtec anomalous community. Even then, were woefully underprepared for the vast arsenal of anomalous weaponry at their supply.

**Other Detail:** We employed various [*http://www.scpwiki.com/scp-1182 artifacts] and spells to remain undetectable to all guards and security systems when entering the facilities. However, the effects of these anomalies were negated by the All-Seeing Eye, resulting in the intervention of Bookburner strike teams. Acting in self-defense, we were forced to engage in direct combat, leading to numerous casualties [[footnote]]May they be remembered by those who come after. — M.X.[[/footnote]]

Fortunately, we were ultimately capable of deactivating the All-Seeing Eye, buying us several weeks to organize the resistance into a full-scale uprising.

[[/div]]

[[div style="border:solid 1px #112211; background:#EEF6EE; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 3px;"]]

[[=]]
**Observations & Stories**
[[/=]]

Prior to the raid, we came in contact with an ex-Bookburner operative by the name of Adrian Ross[[footnote]]He actually found us. Reasonable, if paranoid, but, hey, I would be too if I'd just defected from the Coalition — M.X.[[/footnote]]. He proved to be vital as an informant, as his investigative reconnaissance skills proved crucial in developing plans for engagement.

Ross follows his own path, investigating the rubedo trade[[footnote]]Smuggling. We're dealing with cartels, for fuck's sake. — M.X.[[/footnote]][[footnote]]You don't have to like it, you just have to do it. — L.S.[[/footnote]] of the Blood District. He has come to us for information, and just as easily, we have offered it to him — in exchange for his cooperation.

Several days after initial contact, Ross offered several classified documents to us as proof he had cut ties with the Bookburners. Of note are the following excerpts from his personal journal.
 
> **07/19/2023**
>
> Third time's the charm — here's hoping the guards won't be on watch again. Then again, I heard they'd just finished installing a new thaumaturgical security system. No clue how they were able to get their hands on something like that, but hey, that's the least of my worries right now.

> **7/22/2023**
>
> Last few days have been rough on me. Worked out that Jaiden was deployed to Eurtec, swept away on some sting operation involving smuggling and revolution. They say that the Serpent's Hand have been acquiring some alchemical substance to build bombs[[footnote]]Not true in the slightest. — M.X.[[/footnote]] or something.
>
> Looks like I'll be negotiating with terrorists[[footnote]]Somewhat true, depending on how you look at it, I guess. — M.X.[[/footnote]] now.

> **7/23/2023**
>
> Considering their fearsome reputation, they've been surprisingly reasonable, deeming my search "noble". Of course, they still have their doubts — they need proof that I'm not yet another Coalition spy[[footnote]]Would've been the third that month. — M.X.[[/footnote]][[footnote]]Would've been your own fault for making the recruitment process so straightforward. You were posting fliers in //Downtown Halfway,// for goodness' sake! — L.S.[[/footnote]][[footnote]]To be fair, we put them up on Market Street first before moving them to Downtown, but, yeah, I do see your point. — M.X.[[/footnote]]. Ended up giving them everything I had on Eurtec at a drop spot, but they only took files about the GOC's computing networks for whatever reason.
>
> Soon enough, they'll get me in touch with the leaders of some Serpent's Hand-sympathizing rubedo gang[[footnote]]I keep correcting him, but he seems intent on calling us a gang. We're a //cell//, not a syndicate. — M.X.[[/footnote]]. From there, I'll have to work out the rest on my own.

[[/div]]

[[div style="border:solid 1px #112211; background:#EEF6EE; padding: 20px; margin-bottom: 3px;"]]

[[=]]
**Doubt**
[[/=]]

It is worth mentioning the presence of thaumaturgical defense systems and weaponry utilized by the Bookburners. It is currently unknown how they acquired such resources, but it would suggest that they have been funded by an anonymous source.

Who this source is and what their motivations are remain unknown at the moment, but it is apparent that whoever that person or organization is, they have a vested interest in keeping the Coalition in power.
[[/div]]

[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[footnoteblock title=""]]
